member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.CA1008DiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary:
CA1008: Enums should have zero value
Cause: An enumeration without an applied System.FlagsAttribute does not define a member that has a value of zero; or an enumeration that has an applied FlagsAttribute defines a member that has a value of zero but its name is not 'None', or the enumeration defines multiple zero-valued members.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.CA1012DiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary: CA1012: Abstract classes should not have public constructors

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.CA1024DiagnosticAnalyzer`1
member.summary:
CA1024: Use properties where appropriate
Cause: A public or protected method has a name that starts with Get, takes no parameters, and returns a value that is not an array.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.CA1060DiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary: CA1060 - Move P/Invokes to native methods class

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.CA1008CodeFixProviderBase
member.summary: CA1008: Enums should have zero value

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.CA1012CodeFixProvider
member.summary: CA1012: Abstract classes should not have public constructors

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.EnumWithFlagsCodeFixProviderBase
member.summary: CA1027: Mark enums with FlagsAttribute CA2217: Do not mark enums with FlagsAttribute

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.EnumWithFlagsDiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary:
Implements CA1027 and CA2217
1) CA1027: Mark enums with FlagsAttribute
Cause: The values of a public enumeration are powers of two or are combinations of other values that are defined in the enumeration, and the System.FlagsAttribute attribute is not present. To reduce false positives, this rule does not report a violation for enumerations that have contiguous values.
2) CA2217: Do not mark enums with FlagsAttribute
Cause: An externally visible enumeration is marked with FlagsAttribute and it has one or more values that are not powers of two or a combination of the other defined values on the enumeration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Design.StaticTypeRulesDiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary: CA1025: Static holder types should be sealed

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotCallOverridableMethodsInConstructors
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not call overridable methods in constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotCallOverridableMethodsInConstructorsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called)..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotLockOnObjectsWithWeakIdentity
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not lock on objects with weak identity..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotLockOnWeakIdentity
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not lock on a reference of type '{0}' as it has weak identity. Replace that with a lock against an object with strong identity..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotMarkEnumsWithFlags
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not mark Enum with FlagsAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotMarkEnumsWithFlagsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The enumeration does not appear to contain a consistent set values that can be combined using the OR (|) and AND (&amp;amp;) operators. Using the Flags attribute on an enumeration suggests that the enumeration values are meant to be combined using the AND and OR operators. Typically, a flags enumeration uses values that are either powers of two, or combine other values that are powers of two..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.DoNotMarkEnumsWithFlagsMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to '{0}' is marked with FlagsAttribute but a discrete member cannot be found for every settable bit that is used across the range of enum values. Remove FlagsAttribute from the type or define new members for the following (currently missing) values: '{1}'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.EnumsShouldHaveZeroValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enums should have zero value..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.EnumsShouldHaveZeroValueDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An enum should generally have a zero value. If the enum is not decorated with the Flags attribute, it should have a member with a value of zero that represents the empty state. Optionally, this value is named 'None'. For a Flags-attributed enum, a zero-valued member is optional and, if it exists, should always be named 'None'. This value should indicate that no values have been set in the enum. Using a zero-valued member for other purposes is contrary to the use of the Flags attribute in that the bitwise AN [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.EnumsShouldZeroValueFlagsMultipleZero
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Remove all members that have the value zero from '{0}' except for one member that is named 'None'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.EnumsShouldZeroValueFlagsRename
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to In enum '{0}', change the name of '{1}' to 'None'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.EnumsShouldZeroValueNotFlagsNoZeroValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Add a member to '{0}' that has a value of zero with a suggested name of 'None'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.FieldIsOfNonSerializableType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Field {0} is a member of type {1} which is serializable but is of type {2} which is not serializable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.IdentifierNamesShouldDifferMoreThanCase
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {0} '{1}' have identical names in a case-insensitive manner..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCase
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Identifier names should differ by more than case.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not use names that require case sensitivity for uniqueness. Components must be fully usable from both case-sensitive and case-insensitive languages. Since case-insensitive languages cannot distinguish between two names within the same context that differ only by case, components must avoid this situation..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.ImplementSerializationConstructor
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Implement Serialization constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.ImplementSerializationConstructorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The constructor signature accepts the same arguments as ISerializable.GetObjectData, namely, a SerializationInfo instance and a StreamingContext instance. The constructor should be protected for non-sealed classes and private for sealed classes. Failure to implement a serialization constructor will cause deserialization to fail, and throw a SerializationException..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.InterfaceNamesShouldStartWithI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Interface names should be prefixed with 'I'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkAllNonSerializableFields
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Mark all non-serializable fields..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkAllNonSerializableFieldsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to All fields that cannot be serialized directly should have the NonSerializedAttribute. Types that have the SerializableAttribute should not have fields of types that do not have the SerializableAttribute unless the fields are marked with the NonSerializedAttribute..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkEnumsWithFlags
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Mark Enum with FlagsAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkEnumsWithFlagsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The enumeration appears to be made up of combinable flags. If this true, apply the Flags attribute to the enumeration..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkEnumsWithFlagsMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The constituent members of '{0}' appear to represent flags that can be combined rather than discrete values. If this is correct, mark the enumeration with FlagsAttribute..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkISerializableTypesWithAttribute
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.MarkISerializableTypesWithAttributeDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.PInvokesShouldNotBeVisible
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to P/Invokes should not be visible..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.RemoveEmptyFinalizers
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Remove empty finalizers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.RemoveEmptyFinalizersDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Finalizers should be avoided where possible, to avoid the additional performance overhead involved in tracking object lifetime..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Seal attribute types for improved performance. Sealing attribute types speeds up performance during reflection on custom attributes..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.SerializableTypeDoesntHaveCtor
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Serializable type {0} doesn't have a serialization constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.SerializationCtorAccessibilityForSealedType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Declare serialization constructor for sealed type {0} as private.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.SerializationCtorAccessibilityForUnSealedType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Declare serialization constructor for unsealed type {0} as protected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.SpecifyMarshalingForPInvokeStringArguments
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specify marshaling for P/Invoke string arguments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.SpecifyMarshalingForPInvokeStringArgumentsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to When marshaling strings as ANSI (or as Auto on Win9x), some characters may be changed. If best-fit mapping is on, strings that appear different in Unicode will be marshaled to identical ANSI strings, which may lead to incorrect security decisions. Turning best-fit mapping off reduces this risk, as all characters without equivalents are mapped to '?'. Also, note that CharSet.Ansi is the default setting for all string marshaling; Unicode marshaling must be specified explicitly, either as a CharSet setting of [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Type '{0}' is a static holder type but is neither static nor NotInheritable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.StaticHolderTypesShouldBeStaticOrNotInheritable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Static holder types should be Static or NotInheritable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.StaticHolderTypesShouldNotHaveConstructors
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Static holder types should not have instance constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.StaticHolderTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Type '{0}' is a static holder type and should not contain Instance Constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.StringComparisonShouldBeOrdinalDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For non-linguistic comparisons, StringComparison.Ordinal or StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase should be used instead of the linguistically-sensitive StringComparison.InvariantCulture..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to String comparison should use StringComparison.Ordinal or StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Type parameter names should be prefixed with 'T'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.TypesThatOwnDisposableFieldsShouldBeDisposable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Types that own disposable fields should be disposable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.UseGenericEventHandlerInstances
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Use System.EventHandler<T> where T inherits System.EventArgs or use System.EventHandler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.UsePropertiesWhereAppropriate
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Use properties where appropriate..

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.FxCopRulesResources.UsePropertiesWhereAppropriateDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Properties should be used instead of Get/Set methods in most situations. Methods are preferable to properties in the following situations: the operation is a conversion, is expensive or has an observable side-effect; the order of execution is important; calling the member twice in succession creates different results; a member is static but returns a mutable value; or the member returns an array..

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Performance.CA1813DiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary: CA1813: Seal attribute types for improved performance. Sealing attribute types speeds up performance during reflection on custom attributes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Performance.CA1813CodeFixProviderBase
member.summary: CA1813: Avoid unsealed attributes

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Performance.CA1821CodeFixProvider
member.summary: CA1821: Remove empty finalizers

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Reliability.CA2002DiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary:
CA2002: Do not lock on objects with weak identities
Cause: A thread that attempts to acquire a lock on an object that has a weak identity could cause hangs.
Description: An object is said to have a weak identity when it can be directly accessed across application domain boundaries. A thread that tries to acquire a lock on an object that has a weak identity can be blocked by a second thread in a different application domain that has a lock on the same object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Usage.CA2213DiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary:
CA2213: Disposable fields should be disposed
TODO: this needs to be re-implemented because it requires flow analysis to determine if the dispose operations occur on every path through the dispose method. Flow analysis is not yet implemented.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Usage.CA2214DiagnosticAnalyzer`1
member.summary:
CA2214: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Cause: The constructor of an unsealed type calls a virtual method defined in its class.
Description: When a virtual method is called, the actual type that executes the method is not selected until run time. When a constructor calls a virtual method, it is possible that the constructor for the instance that invokes the method has not executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FxCopAnalyzers.Usage.CA2213CodeFixProviderBase
member.summary: CA2213: Disposable fields should be disposed

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.DiagnosticCustomTags.s_microsoftCustomTags
member.summary: it is string[] because DiagnosticDescriptor expects string[].
